caption.p: Animal origin of human coronaviruses. SARS- CoV (A) emerged from bats, infected civets and humans and adapted to these hosts before causing the SARS epidemic. MERS- CoV (B) likely spilled over from bats to dromedary camels. SARS-CoV-2 (C) emerged from bats spilled over to human either directly or by previous infecting pangolins. Reverse zoonosis transmission (from human to cats, dogs, and tiger) refers only to SARS-CoV-2.
